They emailed me a shipping label which I printed of on Dec 12. On Dec 14th the device was mailed to them. I was provided with a tracking number showing my device was delivered to their warehouse in Processing Center 7213 Global Drive Zip 40258 in Louisville Ky. According to the post office they PICKED up my phone on Dec 16th 2023 at 2:55pm.  I waited to reach out by email on Dec 19th. They responded saying they have no record of my transaction. My transaction was cancelled after I mailed in my device. I provided imei number, talked to 2 people on different occasions to try to get my phone back. I provided them with all documentation of this transaction. No one has contacted me or really tried to help with located my device. This was an horrible experience and now I have no iPhone or no offer. Terribley disappointed.

Review.Titre: Absolutely terrible business practices do not trust
Review.Contenu: I recently had an extremely disappointing experience with Gazelle. Their customer support felt completely scripted and unhelpful. Whenever I reached out with an issue, it seemed like they were more interested in persuading me to cancel my service rather than actually resolving the problem. This approach not only felt forceful but also left me with unresolved issues every time.Moreover, the pricing advertised by Gazelle was misleading. Initially, they lured me in with what appeared to be competitive prices. However, once I signed up, the reality was quite different. They even tried to entice me with a "25% off if you cancel" offer. But here's the catch: when I actually decided to cancel and use this offer, the final price I would of ended up paying was more than the original amount I was supposed to pay without the discount. This kind of bait-and-switch tactic is not only unethical but also a blatant disregard for honest business practices.In summary, my experience with Gazelle was far from satisfactory. Their customer support is ineffective and seems geared more towards getting rid of customers rather than helping them. The pricing strategy is deceptive, leading to higher costs than initially advertised. I would advise potential customers to be wary of their offers and customer service tactics.

Gave me a quote. Phone and iPad were near perfect condition. Make, model and specs were accurate. They then received the devices and offered me less than a quarter of what was quoted. I used this company several years ago and it was excellent. Something has happened and they've slid into a very dishonest practice. So disappointed. I wish I had looked at recent reviews and seen that their ranking has slid to below 10th in this category.

Review.Titre: I sent a perfect condition iPad to them…

Similar to another poster I also had a horrible experience with them just now. Never ever try to sell to Gazelle.Despite reading several reviews over the internet, I still gave it a try because I had my 128GB iPhone11 in pristine condition. I thought they would appreciate the condition and will not lowball me. This device was originally bought with TMobile and eventually got it unlocked. As for the phone description on gazelle , I chose Unlocked and Flawless condition as it was always in an Otterbox case with screen protector. Other than battery down to 80%, there is nothing on this phone that would be different from a new iphone.That said, Gazelle initially offered $208 for the device which was already lower than about $275 it is going at Swappa, however I chose convenience so I took chances with Gazelle than selling privately. After the initial email of offer, I never got any emails. Neither when they received my device nor when they adjusted offer. I had to keep checking their website periodically to find out the status.Today upon checking the site I figured that they lowballed  the offer to $121 with a generic reason that "We had adjusted the offer price because either this is not the same device you selected or it had too many scratches".I took videos and pictures of the device before sending it in and I swear there is not even a single scratch on the device (not even a micro scratch if those are a thing).The device was perfectly unlocked as it was also used on AT&T and Verizon networks after initial TMobile network.Not sure what their real reason for lowballing is, but anyone who is on the fence like I was - wondering if they should send their device to Gazelle - Based on my own experience, I would strongly advise against it.You would be better off selling it yourself on other platforms or even donating it to someone, than getting such shameful offer from them for a pristine device that even I was truly surprised after I took the case off... it was in such mint condition.I declined the offer and asked for my device back.. Another mistake I made was to send the device in the original iPhone Box and now they are saying they will not be sending the box back as they recycled it.Such a big mistake I made.. but then they say.. you only learn from your mistakes.. what a waste of time and energy...more hassles that I wanted to save myself initially from selling privately.I only hope that they send the device in the condition that they received. Only time will tell.

Asked for supervisor, was told supervisor would call me back.12/7/23 supervisor returned call, could only offer to have me return phone and buy another one, which prices had gone up since I purchased durning Black Friday sale, or I could call Apple. I called Apple, we could not fix over the phone so an appointment was set up for me to go to Apple Store which was 1.5 hour drive each way.Gazelle, you should be ashamed of this we have product to sell, oops, no we don’t have product to sell, oh, we have prove product to sell, opps we don’t have have product, and finally we have product and will even ship it out 2 day fed up to only send it USPS which took 5 days and it was not even a functioning product.  There is no excuse for this circus act!

Gazelle just responded today and DENIED my claim and said that the photos I sent them were of a different phone and not the phone they sent me!! WHAT?!? Review.Titre: Downgrade of valuation due to excessive scratches…. On a near perfect iPad Pro 12.9 device!
Review.Contenu: I did a trade-in of an iPad Pro 12.9 256GB Gray Wi-Fi Only in near perfect condition. Thinking I was protecting myself on the rare chance there was a mishap, I took photos of the front and back prior to packaging and sending off to Gazelle. Gazelle received my device soon thereafter (Nov 15 2023), assessed my trade-in as scratched in excess and they downgraded my valuation from $469 to $216. If the iPad I traded in is indeed now scratched, it was done after receiving the device by Gazelle.I used Gazelles packaging and followed their instructions. After learning of the downgrade in validation, I called (on Nov 15) provided photo evidence and asked for an escalation to re-examine, hoping they made an honest mistake. 3 weeks later and after many phone calls and unfulfilled promises, I hear the same thing every time I call: We dont have a status update, we are sending an email to the warehouse, you will receive an update directly from the warehouse in 2-3 days. I dont know if this is fraud, incompetence, or theft but I am out $469 on a trade-in of a perfectly good device. I really wish I would have taken what Apple offered, $400. Yes, I am pissed! I really wish I would have researched what I thought was a company with a stellar history. With very little hope Gazelle will actually re-examine my device and value it fairly (in line with its condition on trade-in as documented by the included photos), I now am in a state of disgust and feel like I probably lost $469 that I really could have put to good use this Christmas season.Hey Gazelle — look at the email I sent with pictures taken just seconds before placing the iPad securely in the box you sent me!!! Don’t even dare respond and say it had scratches. The pictures tell a different story!!!

To top it off the phone that I ordered was on a cyber sale, and has increased in price considerably, so they wanted me to pay a few hundred dollars more for their mistake. . Review.Titre: I have sent in my phone which is an…

They also say that if the phone is in better condition when it is inspected that they will pay you more, so I figured just be safe and pick the lightly used option. Today I get an email and they are saying my phone is in even worse condition and instead of the tentative $437 offer they want to pay me $292. Unacceptable, this phone was always in a case and is in much better condition than the example shown. Pay me the $437 or send me the phone back. I don’t play games.It gets even worse! December 5th still no word on where the phone is but it hasn’t been reinspected. This has been going on since November 21st. No communication, no one has reached out. You can’t talk to anyone in the USA for help. So at this point I guess my phone has been stolen thanks gazelle

Review.Titre: Disreputable Company. They made a mistake in receiving the…
Review.Contenu: They made a mistake in receiving the phone I tried to sell them. As a result they would only pay $78 less than what they originally offered me. I tried calling and emailing them numerous times but they ignored me. In my opinion they are a disreputable company. I definitely will not use them again.

Sent a flawless condition iPhone 13 to Gazelle for sale using their prepaid packaging and label. Inspection report came back stating it had a crack and several scratches, and reduced the offer by several hundred dollars. Needless to say I rejected their offer. Over one week later and they have yet to return my phone despite issuing a claim.

Package never delivered, package was never received,, I will need the phone or my money back,, the last 2 phones I purchased with GAZELLE I never had a problem or issue,, this time the company is avoiding me by email or phone,, Any attorneys here?? I need help

Review.Titre: I ordered a phone useable on verizon
Review.Contenu: I ordered a phone useable on verizon. I rcd a phone for tmobile.  Called the help line and experienced a most unprofessional person and response.  Was told it could take 30 days to send back and get resent.  Person could not give a flip and not even an I'm sorry or we will make it right.  I have sent the phone back so now will see how long it takes to get a phone.

Sent the wrong item, then refused to send a replacement. Said I had to order again and they will process return once received. I requested expedited shipping for the return to get the correct item in time for son's birthday, but they refused. Bought replacement from Best Buy and will not use Gazelle again.

Review.Titre: They will undercut you once they have your phone
Review.Contenu: I sent my phone once and they changed the offer from about $170 to $140 as it was locked vs unlocked.  I requested it back to get it unlocked by ATT but they were clueless.  So I resubmitted it to them with an offer of $143 and now they are telling me it has too many scratches and are offering me $67. Seriously?  It’s the same phone in the same mint condition.  What a waste of time.  They will always undercut you.  Don’t expect to get what they offer!And in response to their response, they quoted $141 two weeks ago when it was locked (before returned to me and then back to them for the $143 quote), so what scratches could they possibly have found now, unless they did it.  It’s a joke.  Be careful!  They aren’t worth the risk unless you are desperate!

Review.Titre: I sent in an iPhone XR in excellent…
Review.Contenu: I sent in an iPhone XR in excellent condition for which they said was worth $120.  When they received it, they said it had scratches (not so) and offered $105. When I refused and asked for the phone to be returned, I was told it was sent and I would have it within 10 business days.  They never sent me a tracking number and now they say it was sent and received and must have been stolen, I should notify the police. Claim #C02703129 I get multiple packages every week and NOTHING has ever disappeared!

Lackluster customer service and trade-in values well below what they advertise online.  I sent in an iphone 12 pro that was in great condition and received an offer below their advertised value for a broken/damaged phone.  Sent the phone back to the "warehouse" for reinspection and basically wasted 2 weeks while they sat on their hands doing nothing.  Had to contact them every couple days to finally get the device "reinspected" only for them to send back the exact same bs offer.  At this point it is not worth trying to send the phone somewhere else, but I sure won't trade in a device with Gazelle ever again.  What a waste of time and comical bait/and switch tactics.

Textbook bait and switch operation. They made an offer on my mint iPhone 13 Pro, and when I sent it in, they dropped the offer by $200 because they said the phone was in poor condition. Obviously, they are not looking at the phones they receive. They automatically reply with a lowball offer in hopes you are dumb enough to accept it. The owner/operators of this business are the lowest forms of life.

SCAM! WASTE OF TIME! I sent my iPhone 12 Pro Max in with an original quote. When they received my phone, they said there were scratches and took almost 40% off the original quote. Impossible! The phone has been in a case with also a screen protector since the day I got it. I called and made a complaint and they said they would review the phone. They told me it would take 2 to 3 business days. So I called on the 4th business day and they told me it would take another 2 to 3 business days. Now I’m frustrated. So when I called again on the third business day (10th business day) I said I had enough and want my phone back in the original condition I sent it.I haven’t got it back yet but I hope they didn’t scratch it themselves.Is this how they lure people in? Only to see if they cave in the end? How unethical. Please do not waste your time with this company. You are actually better off with a local scam artist.

Review.Titre: The Gazelle staff was interested in…
Review.Contenu: The Gazelle staff was interested in helping themselves and not the customer .They did not want to entertain important questions about the purchase or product.

Review.Titre: I would give them zero stars if I…
Review.Contenu: I would give them zero stars if I could.  They gave me a price for my IPhone 14 Pro Plus in good condition—I thought it was locked with Verizon but they said it was unlocked.  Instead of offering more they offered more than $100 less.  I checked online and it showed $200 more than what they offered me.  I rejected their offer and now have my phone back.  BEWARE of Gazelle’s shady business practices.  Once they have your phone they will try to retrade your price.

Gazelle deliberately and grossly misrepresented the value and condition of my iPad pro sent in to sell to them. Their estimate was $60 - when they received it they claimed "screen didn't fully light up" and more than "acceptable amount of scratches". They revised the offer to $12.  This was most certainly a blatant bait and switch ploy not a subjective disagreement. The iPad pro screen worked perfectly and there was not a single scratch, not even a minor one.  It was in absolutely pristine condition. Rather than be tempted to just accept the $12 and be done with it, I demanded it be returned to me. Sure enough, upon receiving it back I confirm it is in absolutely mint condition.  It was protected its whole life by a case and screen protector, so there wasn't even the slightest scratch and the screen lights up perfect. It has at least several more good years left.  I will never do business with Gazelle again.

I purchased an iphone 12plus for $ 469 ON Jun19,2023. The phone died for no reason at all on September 23, 2023. Because it is out of the 30 day return window, they refused to offer any consideration. I was transferred to an offshore call center that could not care less. I will never do business with these people again.  Buyer beware. KM-Philadelphia area.

Review.Titre: High priced offers, lowball actual payouts
Review.Contenu: Like everyone else my offers were too good to be true and were adjusted downward after "inspection".  Since rejecting their offer, I have been waiting for a tracking number or something that says my device is being returned.  Six days and nothing. Do yourself a favor and do not sell to Gazelle unless you're ok with your offer being summarily lowered without proof.  They are 100% banking on sellers accepting the lowball offers.  If you do reject, plan on more frustration as your "returned device" goes into an abyss of delays with little to no communication or ETA for return.  This company has no process, their inspections are arbitrary, and their support teams lack access to any real data, so the entire process isn't fun, fast, or efficient.

Review.Titre: Damaged phone upon receipt and long customer service response times
Review.Contenu: Took pictures and a video of my phone, great condition, always covered.  Magically, they show pictures with plenty of scratches and blemishes after they receive it.  Shady and untrustworthy.

I sent them two iPhone 14 Pro's in perfect condition.  Yet, they claimed one had "excessive scratches", the other one had "pixels missing."  Neither are true, but they have your phones.  Gazelle reduced their offer significantly, but offered to return them.  The problem with that is, that values are going down, and I have no idea what condition they are in at this point.  Both phones were in fantastic shape, and were shipped in original boxes with film on the front / back, and were double boxed.  I accepted their offer, just to make the problem go away, but I'd never use them again.  I upgrade my phones every year, and have never had a problem like this with Apple, Declutter, Amazon, or eBay.  Before I decided to try Gazelle, I checked their reviews, and I saw some similar to my experience, but thought these reviewers were malcontents.  I learned my lesson.

Not one customer service representative helped answer my questions or take any ownership of the problem I had with the iPhone 13 Pro Max I purchased from you.   My camera stopped working and said unknown part, not a genuine apple part.  I was told to contact the warranty company for my problem.  The thing is, this isn’t a warranty issue.  This is an issue with Gazelle for selling me a phone that didn’t have a genuine apple part in it and doesn’t work properly.  No one has a phone number and it’s like pulling teeth to get a supervisor to take ownership of a problem.  I shouldn’t have to call and repeat my information 10 different times.  How I feel now, I don’t trust Gazelle.  You still have the ability to change that.

Review.Titre: Scamming Company who takes advantage of you
Review.Contenu: I received an offer to sell a brand new, unopened Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 256 (Unlocked). When I sent the phone to the company, they sent me a note with a reduce offer stating my phone is other and not unlocked. The offer was reduced to half as well. I declined the offer and they returned my device removed from the box without the box and accessories the phone came with. I called the company and they refused to return. This company is a scam, and taking advantage of people. They give you a high offer to get you to send them your device, then they make up reasons to reduce the price, hoping you are desperate and will agree so they can increase their profit.

This company is extraordinarily dishonest.  If you send them a phone to sell, they will attempt to adjust the price significantly downward after receiving it by falsely claiming something about the condition, without providing any evidence.

Review.Titre: They sold me a phone a did not honor…
Review.Contenu: They sold me a phone a did not honor the saleThis transaction has become worse after speaking with Liza, she has informed me there is no record of the purchase that was not honored based on a contract made and satisfied with monies requested. These further illuminate the poor business practiced at gazelle.com

*STAY AWAY.* When I wanted to change providers for the phone I purchased through Gazelle, I learned that the phone couldn't be unlocked because it had not been paid off by the previous owner. The carrier told me it is "essentially stolen," and that Gazelle should refund, which they refuse to do because it was discovered after the 30 day refund window (true--but there was no way to know about the problem until I wanted to change carriers). They say they “can’t override” the refund window, which of course is not true. I can't believe I have been unknowingly carrying around an illegal, unpaid-for phone. This was a fraudulent transaction, and Gazelle refuses to make it right. A dishonest company. BUYERS BEWARE.

They quote you higher prices then when you send the device to them they lower the offer over $100 stating that the device has to many scratches. But if you go onto their website and initiate a new quote for the same device and choose the option for scratches the quote they give is still $70 higher than what they actually give you. My phone was kept in a case its whole life. Hardly any scratches on the device. Customer service was no help at all in fact the rep didn’t deny that they quote at higher amounts than they actually pay out.

I recently bought a iphone 13pro in “excellent” condition,meaning the “a grade” the best they had to offer. At first I only noticed its way more scratched than it’s supposed to and the battery is 87% but I said whatever, after a few days I noticed that it has oled screen burn issues. So both the screen and the body of the phone were not grade A yet thats what my order said. Im not gonna deny they have good prices but the condition of the product is horrible. I can’t bother with sending it back for a refund since I left the country and I need it as a primary device but I don’t want anyone else to be in my position

Was offered $690 for my Samsung ultra 256gb (unlocked) they say the model I sent is (other) instead of unlocked and knocked $360 off my offer. The phone is direct from Samsung and is def exactly as described and network unlocked… wasted my time. Asked for it to be retuned, hopefully I actually get it back. ***Update: 10/10/23Got the phone back, but no box and no charging cable that was sent with it in the first place. Just a horrible experience overall.

Review.Titre: I got a phone that doesn’t work…
Review.Contenu: I got a phone that doesn’t work properly I can’t hear anyone unless I put them on speaker. I reached out to gazelle about fixing this by either returning it for another device or returning it for a refund I have not heard back from them so I’m leaving this review. I spent almost $400 for a half broken phone thanks Gazelle

Review.Titre: Got a phone with 77% battery life
Review.Contenu: Got a phone with 77% battery life. was told by gazelle  if i wanted a battery life better than 80% should buy new.

Review.Titre: We purchased a IPhone 8 Plus from you…
Review.Contenu: We purchased a IPhone 8 Plus from you last August for $185 and a month ago beginning having issue for no reason at all. Took it to two places for diagnosis. Gazelle would not work with us with any kind of a discount on replacing the phone.  Highly disappointed as we have purchase previously several phones from you.
The speaker doesn't work. Now I have to return it. I can't get an exchange, so i have to return it first, then I can buy a new one.

Worst experience. If you talk or chat with any representative, they will make you fool. They will tell you that they have send mail to management and now management will connect with you. and after that no response.  The online site showing different price and tax for same state. Also, site will cancel your order if you're shipping and mailing address is not same. Last and most important, the discount code and money will display but the order will cancelled automatically and if you try again then discount code will not work it will tell you that you have already used and on call the representative will give you false promise and make you fool.

Review.Titre: Received a defective item it would not…
Review.Contenu: Received a defective item it would not install the required software update, when try to exchange was not an easy process and the agent advised they could not help me ask to speak to a supervisor or someone that could help but was placed on hold for over 15 minutes. I returned the item and will not be purchasing anything else

Review.Titre: Scammers at every stage of the process. Then promised a payout and never kept their word.
Review.Contenu: I had a horrible experience. They lost my device for weeks, then mislabeled and misregistered an incorrect broken device of a different generation to my trade in case after about 5 hours on the phone asking them to look for the missing device in the warehouse. The device was then graded as $0 value. The claims agent, who had no interest in acknowledging any of the many warehouse mistakes other agents has explained over the phone begrudgingly promised a $50 payment given the situation, despite multiple reasonable appeals. He said this was (more than two times the payment due for the graded value). This raises three major issues. 1. Gazzele takes zero responsibility for their own internal problems and disorganization. 2. if the device in question was graded to be worth ~$25 (half of $50 offered) why did the inspectors recycle the device with a $0 value (downgrades seem to be a common tactic) 3. this agent, Michael never kept his word in issuing the promised payout amount, and the company has ignored many follow emails I have sent since that (poor) resolution was offered.

Order an excellent condition phone which mean it’s supposed not have any signs of wear but when I got it and unboxed it I seen that there are scratches by the charging port. If I knew that I would have paid for a good or fair condition phone. I contacted customer service and they did not offer any solutions then when I ask for them to refund partial since I paid for an excellent phone but received a good or fair phone instead and I just wanted a partial refund of the difference from what I paid for which is an excellent phone but I received a good or fair condition phone so it’s a ripoff and they over charge their customers and don’t want to help when they is a problem. If I knew this I would have bought the iPhone 15 pro max from Apple. Don’t recommend!

Review.Titre: Device had missing sim card tray
Review.Contenu: Device I received had a missing sim card tray. When I contacted Gazelle they offered me to return the phone but didn’t match the price that I paid for the same phone. I was ok to even wait to get the SIM card tray but they didn’t offer that either. I have to purchase the SIM card tray separately from eBay. Gazelle customer service wasn’t helpful.

They grade phones like gemstones. I sent in an always in a  case iPhone 12 in great condition. No cracks dents dings etc.  You would really  have to look to find any scratch. My assumption is if you get the perfect angle and shine a light on it you’ll see surface scratches caused by microscopic dust particles in your case or when your phone is in your pocket. Insane.  They graded my perfectly working great condition phone as poor???? I wish i could post pictures here.  It’s not  a piece of art or a rare baseball card but that’s how they grade your phone to low ball the original offer they gave you. Look elsewhere

Review.Titre: I sent in a brand new
Review.Contenu: I sent in a brand new, unopened iPad. They offered me $187.00. They received my item on Oct 4. I did not hear anything until OCT 22, almost 3 weeks later. They AUTO accepted an offer of $81.00 and refused to "reinspect" or open the offer back up. I also have not received any money. I am reporting them for fraud to the BBB. DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY!!They responded and said it was damaged. This is NOT TRUE! It was in Apple original packaging, unopened. Not damaged.

Don’t order from this company. You’ll pay $50 for shipping for them to not tell you ANYTHING about WHEN you’ll get your product. They’ll refuse to cancel the order. Tell you they’re escalating it and management will reach out with no response and then try and say it’s fed exs fault for not picking the order up yet. They won’t refund the expedited shipping nor cancel the order EVEN THOUGH ITS SITTING IN THEIR WAREHOUSE!! I think they screwed up and don’t have the product and refuse to cancel my order or refund my money.

Review.Titre: Like many other reviews, Gazelle is a scam!!!!
Review.Contenu: Like so many other reviews, Gazelle is unethical and quotes slightly above what you would be able to sell your iPhone directly to Apple.  However, once they get the phone, they claim it has 'minor scratches' and reduce the offer by over 50%.  My phone did not have any scratches.  They also did not return the phone back to me in the same original Apple box that I sent to them with the phone.  Do not fall for this scam.
Camcelled my order because physical address and ip address didnt match. Ordered from Reebelo and didnt have any trouble-cheaper too.

Review.Titre: Made my 8th purchase in the last 6…
Review.Contenu: Made my 8th purchase in the last 6 months with Gazelle. Never disappointed until now. Their listing title and specifications stated device had 5G capabilities. It didn’t. For a company that only sells Apple devices they should be 100% accurate on the listing titles and specs. Could t even get an email response to attempt to expedite the exchange process

The site works really well - better than the alternative sites. That it's a central seller rather than a marketplace/individual seller is a real plus for potential quality control. Return was fast and hassle free (assuming I get my refund in timely fashion.)- only reason I gave two stars. BUT- I was sent the wrong color. I could live with that. But- I was sent an Enterprise locked phone. There is no way I can get through phone setup. It was essentially a broken phone.- the materials say call us to help with troubleshooting. In reality, the only things they can do is expedite a return if something is wrong.- I spoke with two reps. The was hard to understand and a little bit of an attitude problem. The second was better at speaker and a bit friendlier.I would be open to trying again - the company seems to be trying, but two mistakes that shouldn't have happened really torpedoed my experienceFollowup: they offered me free shipping on a future order for my review.

Review.Titre: The phone I paid for was sup…
Review.Contenu: The phone I paid for was supposed to be in Good condition. I habe blufht several phones tgeough rhis company so i am truly disappointed usually don’t leave reviews because I don’t have to but the phone already needs a battery replacement as it was never tested according to the sticker that was inside the box for its functionality. I need another phone sent out and I can’t be without a phone as it’s needed for work. This is super inconvenient and truly disappointing. Update: they emailed me to say they will process a return for s full refund. When did i mentioned wanting my money back?i said i just want a phone that works and is fully inspected for quality according to their company’s promises about jow rhe phones are processed before customer receives product. My review still remains UNSATISFACTORY EXPERIENCE. Wont purchase again

Review.Titre: Credit cards not accepted, PayPal only?
Review.Contenu: After attempting to purchase a phone with a credit card multiple times over multiple weeks, I ended up having to create a PayPal account just to pay for what I wanted. This is after contacting support and them not being able to help. Please reference customer support ticket C02718434 and order numbers SHP872331 and SHP874426. Please allow the use of credit cards in the future!

I ordered an IPhone 12 Pro w/512gb in excellent condition. I wanted a Pro with 128/256 gb but they didn't have any in excellent condition so I ordered the more expensive one with 512 gb. The phone they sent me was correct except the condition. They sent me a phone with a grade B condition with 81% battery health. The phone was supposed to be in excellent condition not a grade B. They will not exchange it for what I ordered they will only allow for a return which I do not want to do because it was a black Friday deal and now it would cost me more money to repurchase it.

Review.Titre: My phone came with an 85% battery…
Review.Contenu: My phone came with an 85% battery health which most doesn’t even last half a day, not worth the cost. Untruthful advertising and not giving enough information

I ordered an iPhone in excellent condition and I received one that was in fair or good condition. There were scratches all over the charging port area. Extremely disappointed, had to return. The battery health was also not at 100%.

Review.Titre: They cancelled my order twice citing…
Review.Contenu: They cancelled my order twice citing payment processing issues. I tried it once with mine, and once with my spouse's card, and we generally do not have payment issues on other sites

Review.Titre: Poor support and buying experience, device is fine
Review.Contenu: Purchase was initially canceled by their fraud detection. Had to talk to support several times to re-order and was told I would be reimbursed the value of a promo that I could not reuse when I reordered. When I contacted support again to claim that, they told me they could not do that. By the time I was able to re-order, the color of phone I wanted was no longer available and price had gone up. Really poor experience, but at least I got a phone at the end, which seems more or less what I expected (so far)!
The speaker isn't working correctly on ear piece so very hard to hear calls.

Review.Titre: The phone should have been set up for…
Review.Contenu: The phone should have been set up for Verizon but when trying and not working, Verizon said the phone was t mobile 😑 Now I need to wait a week or more to get the refund so I can try again.  I wish an exchange could happen.

I ordered an iPad in rose gold color for my daughter. A week later an iPad arrived at my house. Spec wise it matches what I ordered but it’s space gray instead of rose gold like I ordered. Their customer service department said no exchanges for the mixup. The only option they gave me was to return the iPad I just bought and try to buy the one I wanted when it’s back in stock. It’s one of the weakest customer service responses I’ve ever received before. Besides the poor customer service and it being the wrong color, the device is otherwise what I expected. That’s the only reason they’re getting more than one star.

Review.Titre: Scam / Avoid - they will give you less than original offer
Review.Contenu: Avoid !  Sent an excellent condition iPhone 13 Pro Max phone to them.  They quoted $618.  Once they received they said it’s unlocked instead of Verizon (not true, but even so WHO cares that would be worth the same or more) and they also said excessive scratches which is a total lie and therefore they lowered offer to $480.  Just trying to scam you into accepting a lower price.  I had them return it.

Review.Titre: Not as good as they used to be…
Review.Contenu: First, the tracking system showed package waiting to be picked up for days. Never got a delivery confirmation either.Second, phone is great but the battery is already showing it needs service. Pretty lame actually, I’ve always been happy with Gazelle in the past but they have gone downhill…

Phone was in good cosmetic shape but the battery has to be charged 3 times a day. Thats if i dont use it. If i do use it, then more often. The sim from verizon wouldn't work and I had trouble connecting to tan E-sim. I also have to send the phone back to replace it before getting a new one, which means I will not have a phone at all. I am just getting another phone.

Review.Titre: 😩 two phones ordered, two returned…both wrong carrier
Review.Contenu: 😩 so far we’ve ordered two phones, same model, etc. I’ve pulled them out of their packaging and plugged them in to charge them. I gave two stars instead of one because both of the phones were in pristine condition. That said, when I went to start them to transfer data, wrong carrier.  TWICE! I ordered Verizon.  First phone was T-Mobile….back it goes.  Ordered #2…AT&T. Come on, Gazelle…you can do better. I just hope my current phone doesn’t become completely unusable before I can get phone number 3. Here’s to “Third time’s a charm…” so frustrating!

I used Gazelle for a number of years and was very satisfied. The past two years I have found they are doing a "bait and switch." I have sent them two flawless, year-old iPhones, and in each case, after having received the phones, reported "scratches" and lowered their offer substantially, figuring that the inconvenience of having the phone returned and finding a new place to sell it would be more bother to me than simply accepting their lower offer. They have lost me as a customer and I will sell my future phones directly to Apple.

Review.Titre: It takes too long to receive your…
Review.Contenu: It takes too long to receive your merchandice, up to now I have not received the phone I purchased. I think twice to buy from you again if I need the product quickly, Then you offer faster shipping for a charge, faster shipping should be Included in your price.
The phone was in good condition and arrived on time but I can't use it because it won't install the update it downloaded. It's been stuck all night.

I ordered 2 Samsung phone, went with good condition rather than fair. Paid $20 extra for each phone. One phone was in good condition but the other one was fair with scratches. I had to send them out and did not had time to reorder a different one so I called to ask to Atleast credit me for the fair condition phone I was told cannot be done. Only option is return not even exchange. Was little disappointed with the service and the incorrect condition on one phone.

Review.Titre: It's been a week and I still haven't…
Review.Contenu: It's been a week and I still haven't received the iphone I've already payed for.  I keep getting updates on delivery every day pushing back the delivery date.  It's extremely annoying.  I should have had that in my possession within a couple of days.

Bought my husband a phone in June. A few months later he started complaining that it wouldn’t charge. I called in October to see if Gazzelle would do anything about the problem. Since it is outside of their 30 day warranty, they will not do anything. When I buy a phone, I expect it to last more than a couple months. I do not recommend.

Purchased iPhone 11 pro refurbished but was to be in Excellent condition.  It arrived in a reasonable amount of time.  The physical appearance was good but it did not function.  It would not move past the select country set up screen.  While Gazelle sent me a label to send it back for a full credit, I didn't even get a "gee, we are sorry, this didn't work out".  Not what I expected.

Still waiting for delivery. I called and cancelled the order, then got mail saying the phone had been shipped. Your company apparently can't coordinate between your warehouse and call center. You can't keep track of your inventory. My social media posts will contain details, including "do not do business with this company." Now, once the phone arrives, I need to return it. More work on my part due to errors on your part.

Purchased 2 phones as gifts. 1 shows more wear than their description states. The other was in slightly better cosmetic condition than description however it was blocked by the carrier and caused them to suspend the number. Returned the 1 blocked device and waiting over 1.5 weeks to process return.  Customer service has no power. Its either keep the device or return. No in-between and neither phone was as expected in the end.

Review.Titre: Another Device that someone is still making payments on.
Review.Contenu: The device was in pretty good condition, but this is the second time in the last few months I bought a device still under someone else’s AT&T financing and I don’t have the option to send it back because I don’t have time, and can’t be without a phone. I can’t even unlock it because it’s not paid off, and if they don’t pay it off, it’ll be blacklisted and eventually blocked from being activated again. This is ridiculous.

I did not get a charging cord for my I phön 12 promax, and was hoping for the mini Sim card as well?… This may indeed be an error on my part(not included).  I’ve upgraded from an iPhone 8, which I bought on gazelle and played happy with, but thought there would be a pamphlet or some literature on this amazing but complicated new device to me :-)

Review.Titre: Not worth the risk for pricey phones.
Review.Contenu: Spent $1100 on a Galaxy s21 Ultra 512 GB phone in January 2022. This price was $100 less than the price for a new 128GB phone and included a 1 year warranty ( paid $70 additional.). Fast forward to July 2023 and the screen suddenly stops working.  Like black screen of death, only flickered twice, poof gone.  Phone still tries to accept calls, but when the touch screen is how you do everything on this phone it’s quite a problem.  $412 later, we have a repaired screen.  Of course, we’re outside of the purchased warranty, so i go to my credit card company for reimbursement using their extended warranty feature.  They deny the claim because it’s a used device- not refurbished— even though I purchased the warranty for it.  Lesson learned to not use Gazelle again for high end phones.

While the phone physical’s appearance having purchased “Good” was just that , no visible scratches or dents from what I saw,  the phone came with two issues that was immediately prompted when the device was turned on. First, the battery was below at 75% and stated it needed to be serviced. And the second, Face ID did not work. Ultimately, have to return.

Review.Titre: Didn’t come out n time for Christmas
Review.Contenu: I made my order on December 19th around 4am and my order didn’t shipped out till December 23 and I paid to have it overnight shipping it didn’t arrive on the 23rd and it was a delay and today the 27 I got a update saying I will get it December 27th before 8pm which I’m not going to hold my breath on but on gazelle’s ordering was great but shipping wasn’t so good ups is better choice to have thing shipped fedex not so great this is the second time I had a problem with them

Typically, I have no problem with Gazelle and have bought multiple devices with them. However, this time it said my order was delayed, which was understandable due to the terrible weather and holiday season. However, I never received an email letting me know that the product had been shipped, and I do not know how long it was outside before we realized it was there. The product came and works, so all is well that ends well. Better communication would be better in the future.

I paid for expedited shipping to have it arrive by a certain date. I received a notice that my shipping was going to be delayed and despite contacting multiple times via phone and email, I never got a response. The expedited shipping service I paid for should have been refunded since I never got my device in time.

phone i bought (iphone 13 pro) didn't work properly - front camera was unable to setup face ID.  Returned, but no more stock available.I also sent in an iphone 11 pro for sale and even though in excellent condition gazelle tried to offer me much less than the original (already modest) offer - so i declined the offer and asked that it be returned.Also - hold times when you call are excessive.  Delivery times and processing times are excessive.

Review.Titre: Gazelle refused to honor a bonus coupon…
Review.Contenu: Gazelle refused to honor a bonus coupon that they sent me. I had started an order to sell my phone and was sent a follow up email enticing me with an additional 10% bonus payment. I followed the link and sent in my phone. They reviewed my phone and then gave me a new offer. Long story short, that 10% bonus was not on the revised offer. Two chats (disconnected twice!) and a 25 minute phone call later, I was told to refuse the offer, have my phone shipped back to me and then redo all the paperwork and resend it. I asked how I could be confident they would honor the 10% bonus a second time if they didn’t the first time. The CS rep told me his hands were tied. Either accept the offer or have it returned (and possible lost in the mail or stolen during its return).This was silly and wasteful. I ended up taking the offer without the bonus but will never work with this company again.

Review.Titre: I have gotten phones from Gazelle…
Review.Contenu: I have gotten phones from Gazelle several times, and the one time I had an issue it was resolved promptly. I have been able to use the phones for several years, or until I broke them due to my own negligence.However my last phone, within three days of arriving, requires battery replacement. Well expecting a new battery in a used phone isn’t reasonable, expecting not to have to replace a battery — which costs close to as much as the device itself, and requires loss of the device for twoWeeks— is not unreasonable, and I’m fairly disappointed because this is not the positive experience I am used to having from this company.

Review.Titre: Maybe my expectations were too high?
Review.Contenu: Item listed as excellent; while the iPad mini was in good physical condition, don’t know if it actually worked; arrived completed dead. I was a bit surprised that it had an aftermarket charging cord & came without a wall adapter. I boxed it back up & sent it back for a refund…

Review.Titre: Over all Gazelle product us good
Review.Contenu: Over all Gazelle product us good, but iot charged twice for some reason.  Now it is Christmas time and I have a pending charge on my account that want come off to the 16th.  I already called and yall said I'd does not show a charge but the amount charged is the same of the order but without taxs.

Well, I've tried now 4 times since I received it and it's slightly too small so the Ipad won't fit in. I even watched someone else's unboxing on You Tube, as you provide no instructions, but no joy. Would like some help so I am not just wasting money. It was exactly what I needed!

Review.Titre: I placed my order and then was notified…
Review.Contenu: I placed my order and then was notified 4 days later it was on backorder. It gave me no reason why it went to back order. Once I called to see they processed the order quickly but I am still waiting for my order to be delivered as of today. My order was in my hometown sitting for 4 days and it's now in California with no delivery date in sight. Sooooo frustrated with this!!!

Sent in a (legitimately) near perfect Samsung ****5G phone they had quoted buying at $271. I received an email offering me an adjusted price of $34 which I of course declined. The bad news is when I emailed asking why they said their records showed the phone they received was in "poor" condition (not true). The good news is they sent the phone back undamaged and still in excellent condition (minus the original box I sent in). So I'll sell it elsewhere.

I was sent the wrong device (ordered an Ipad Pro and received an Ipad Mini). When I called customer service, I was quickly sent a return label to send it in for a refund, which was nice. However, I asked to talk to someone about replacing it so I could actually receive what I ordered. I was sent to claims, placed on hold, and never answered. I called again the next day and was told I couldn't exchange it for what I ordered, I would have to get a refund and reorder another device. By that point, the Ipad pros were gone. I will be getting a refund and purchasing elsewhere.

Review.Titre: This is the worst service I’ve ever…
Review.Contenu: This is the worst service I’ve ever had. I can’t believe you sent me a phone that plugged into 100% and then lost 50% of its power the second day which means that something wrong with the battery. I’m gonna call you to return it.

The MacBook Pro I received did not have the OS properly installed. I had to run the disk recovery and reinstall the OS. That's not an issue for me, but when I am spending the money I am I expect to have quality returned to me. Now, I am losing trust in your service.

My first order never notified me that it was on back order and therefore was cancelled. I called customer support twice in which they said, my order in process after a week of no update call back to be told my order was in back order and was never going to be shipped. this is after many hours on EXTREMELY long wait times!!! So unprofessional Second order- found a phone, ordered it and over a week later no update on when I will receive it as the delivery date is not updating and past due. Would probably not shop here again as customer service and support is not helpful.

I have ordered phones through Gazelle before and I have never had a problem. However, this time I had some problems. I ordered a phone and Gazelle emailed me saying it was on backorder. I called to handle the situation and they told me they had the same phone in a different color. I ordered that phone and they emailed me a say later saying it was on backorder. Don't promise things to your customers that aren't true and don't say things are available on your website if they aren't.

Phone itself was in “good” condition as described however it was quite filthy in the charging port and both the upper and lower speakers. Thankfully I was able to clean out the bottom port and speakers but the top speaker quality is fairly diminished due to the dirt and grime build up. If the top speaker wasn’t damaged then I would’ve given a better rating.

So Gazelle is legit BUT you send them a pristine iPhone, they get it and find microscopic (literally you can't see any blemishes) "marks" and downgrade it.  By the time you find out they are screwing you on the price, for most it's not worth the hassle for the difference so you accept their offer and they know this.  I find this up front "look how much we'll pay" and then "yeah just kidding we found an invisible blemish" shady so I will not be doing business with Gazelle again.Now ratholing a bit more with my experience.  I never got an offer from them via email.  So after a couple weeks, I called customer service and got a really snarky guy that sounded Indian who treated me like I was a moron because I couldn't find an email I never got.  He also treated me like a moron because I didn't have the PS number handy but he never said, hey it's buried on the shipping label (which fortunately I'd scanned) where you'd never notice unless you know to look there.  Maybe it was obvious on the email BUT they never sent the email.I did have to contact customer service yet again, but to their credit, they emailed me (oh I guess my email does work fine after all) the code so I at least got the reduced payment.

Review.Titre: Latest Experience And Hopeful for a Resolve
Review.Contenu: Previous two purchases were fantastic! This recent purchase of an iPhone 11 had a defective SIM card port. I spent over four hours, and $100.00 having my phone set up only to discover I needed to return the phone. I requested reimbursement for the $100 but the Gazelle representative stated you were unwilling to accommodate. I look forward to my refund of the phone. I will most certainly purchase another iPhone of my choosing once one becomes available. I’m on the email notification list. I look forward to this next phone being in tiptop technological condition. Thank you in advance.

I ordered two iPhone 12(a purple&a red). I was given one tracking number for my order and so I assumed my 2 phones would be packed and coming together. That is FALSE!!! I have only received one phone and have no idea how to track the second phone. The shop app is the only thing saying that our order has been partially delivered. USPS & gazelle website both say that I have received both phones. I have a purple iPhone 12 but not a red iPhone 12!!!Where is the other phone I spent hundreds of my hard earned money on?!

phone arrived locked when it was advertised as unlocked, wasted time returning and repurchasing from somewhere else,  quality control is lacking, they obviously didnt check the status of the phone when they received it as AT&T said the phone was not paid off.

Review.Titre: Sent a locked iPad Air with LTE
Review.Contenu: Sent a locked iPad Air with LTE, needless to say, unable to bypass activation. The Tech department needs to check the device thoroughly before sending anything out.

Review.Titre: Ordered phones that were supposedly in…
Review.Contenu: Ordered phones that were supposedly in stock but weren’t. Waited multiple days for you guys to tell me they were outta stock even after calling numerous days in a row and being told they were already with the carrier. Terrible experience and I won’t ever do it again.

The order process was great.  I don’t have the phone I ordered.  The transportation company has delayed the shipment without providing an estimate of when it will arrive. I suggest using a more reliable shipping service.

Review.Titre: Package was not delivered to my house
Review.Contenu: Package was not delivered to my house, which technically isn't Gazelles fault but when I called to just confirm they had the correct address in their system I first was on hold long enough to finally just select the call back option. I never received a call back so I called again the following afternoon and waited 20+ minutes to be told that I would have to call them back..again Monday to speak with a senior representative. I feel I've had to do all the legwork for this to be resolved, with the amount of money I spent and now my phone is somewhere and I'm spending my one day off from work to track and manage someone else's mistake.

The saga with Gazelle continues... We received a phone with many issues. Apple confirmed it was DOA and would be a $279 repair. Gazelle customer service responded months later and said it was too late to return. Our carrier informed us that the phone is reported STOLEN. All we want is for to them replace the phone with a working one that we paid for. They keep giving us the run-around. Save yourself a headache and get a phone from a more reliable company.

Review.Titre: Great past experiences but not this time!
Review.Contenu: I’ve had excellent experience(s) with Gazelle recently, but this time they “dropped the ball” big time!I ordered an Unlocked Google Pixel 7 but received a Pixel 7 that is locked to an obscure carrier (Xfinity Mobile) ???When I called Gazelle Support, they weren’t very apologetic and basically told me to just return the locked device and if I wanted to I’d have to put in a brand new order for an Unlocked Pixel 7…

I called 12 hours after purchase to change delivery options and was not allowed to then USPS didn’t even attempt to deliver to my house even though I was home and instead put a notice in the mailbox and lied saying no one was available to sign because signature required.  Overall, not a good experience at all

Review.Titre: iPhone12 Pro was shipped with dead…
Review.Contenu: iPhone12 Pro was shipped with dead battery. After charging, battery capacity was mere 82%. E-mailed Gazelle twice with zero response. Pathetic customer service.

Review.Titre: Love the phone, but issues arose.
Review.Contenu: Love the phone, but it wasn't delivered as advertised. I ordered an unlocked phone only to get a locked phone with no indication in who the service provider was  Customer service was no help, just said to return for a refund.Thanks Gazelle for reaching out. I paid a site to look up the phone information and just activated it with the provider. Yes I had to switch, but I didn't want to have to return the phone.

Review.Titre: 2nd phone in a row with a financial block!
Review.Contenu: This is the second phone in a row that I ordered from Gazelle that came blocked by Verizon (financial obligation on the phone). I used to order phones from Gazelle with no problem. But now I am ready to switch to someplace else. At least they made the return process very easy, which I do appreciate.

Review.Titre: Buy the carrier unlocked phone and save…
Review.Contenu: Buy the carrier unlocked phone and save yourself the hassle.I am on AT&T, bought the AT&T unlocked iPhone 12. It didn’t recognize my sim. Went to the ATT store, still didn’t recognize the new sim they activate. They even tried esim, same outcome. ATT says that the phone isn’t compatible with ATT network.Idk if Gazelle gave me a wrong carrier unlocked phome, but it’s a huge headache. Buy the carrier unlocked phome.

Review.Titre: Received bad device, customer service does not respond
Review.Contenu: The iPhone we got from Gazelle had many issues (bad battery, earpiece broken.) We called and emailed WITHIN the return period. No one ever answered the phone or returned emails until MONTHS later and then told me the return period was over. Then they blamed me for not initiating the return. I will not be purchasing devices from Gazelle again.

Review.Titre: Said in stock but really was not.
Review.Contenu: Well first off it said in stock, then it never showed so I had to reach out to customer service multiple times. Finally, it shipped 8 days late. Then it arrived with the Lighting plug, however, it takes the USB-C cable I almost broke the thing trying to plug the wrong cable in, who does that? I am not an Ipad user so how would I know the cord shipped was not the correct one? Had to use google to figure it out. I have used Gazelle before and think they are a good but the customer service department is lacking, it seems a bit automated and that can be frustrating.

Review.Titre: Iphone Face ID did not work.  Low battery health.
Review.Contenu: Iphone Face ID did not work.  Was able to return after waiting on hold 40 min.  They did pay the return shipping.  I ordered a new device from them.  When received battery health was 78%.  Probably going to just keep it as I am near a charger always.  Both devices were Certified and Excellent condition.

Gazelle sold me an item then told me it was out of stock, I had to jump through multiple hoops and call many times to get through to get the issue resolved. They ended hp giving me a similar phone which was my initial request, basically had to be persistent and tell them how to provide service and correct their problem, if they are a service and sale provider they should be able to take these steps on their own.

Review.Titre: Paid for 2-3 day delivery but it took 7 days to come
Review.Contenu: I paid for 2-3 day delivery, so I could get it before going away, but received it about 7 days after order because the warehouse was unexpectedly closed one day and was off other days when the retail was open.

Review.Titre: The phone that u shipped me is locked
Review.Contenu: The phone that u shipped me is locked. It was supposed to be compatible for T-Mobil. I sent an email about it yesterday, no reply. Today, I called it customer service #, and sat on hold for an hour and 20 minutes before giving up. I have always had good experiences w Gazelle before .  Will I be able to resolve this issue?
The shipping notifications are great and delivery was right on time.The speaker does not work on the phone, which means it's just a hand sized computer, not actually a working phone.

Review.Titre: Backorder resolved but iPhone came with only 86% max capacity and is dropping fast
Review.Contenu: Hello, this is the  4th iphone I've happily purchased from you.  This one was delayed and put on backorder....which is odd since this is a used product so clearly I was sold a phone that no longer was available.  I called and was offered options in a different color, which is great, but I wouldn't have known that unless I called.  The first person I spoke with was not helpful at all. But the second person was great and expedited shipping of the new iphone.  But now with this iphone 12, the battery isn't good and I will need to return/exchange it which is a hassle.  The battery started at an 86% Maximum Capacity and now it's already dropped to 84% after just 2 weeks of light use so I have to carry a charger everywhere I go because it discharges quickly.  So that is not good and I hope Gazelle will resolve it.  Thank you, Kristin

Review.Titre: Lack of exchange resulted in paying $50 more after waiting a month
Review.Contenu: Originally, my eldest purchased a new phone with his own money, and we were going to let him actually get cell service. Except the phone we received was still carrier-locked, which resulted in a month-long journey to get it replaced. Not all of this was in Gazelle's control, like the time it took USPS to get the phone returned. But because Gazelle doesn't have the option to "replace," only to "refund and buy another one", we ultimately paid an extra $50 (and a month of waiting) to end up with the same phone we started with, this time not carrier locked to Cricket.Customer support was varied - at some points quite helpful, at others not as much, and often took many days for a response.Fwiw, this was our first negative experience with Gazelle after getting phones from them for five years, all the previous purchases had no issues.

Review.Titre: Scratched phones with low battery life.
Review.Contenu: The phone had more scratches than expected, the battery life is around 75%. I was told that refurbished phones should have at least 80% of battery life.

I was quite frustrated with how Gazelle handled my order. I understand due to the holidays and weather that my package was not delivered when originally said, however Gazelle told me they could no longer assist with information on my order because it was no longer in their hands, and I had to contact that post office directly. What frustrated me is that they marked my order as complete, and I had not received my phone yet.  Gazelle should not be marking any orders as complete until the phone is in the customers hand even if the delay has to do with the post office, it seemed lazy to me. Thankfully USPS has been corporative and assisted me with all of my questions and concerns and should be receiving my phone today.

Review.Titre: Several problems with the selling process
Review.Contenu: The 10% offer that arrived with the phones I bought couldn't be applied to the phones I was selling for some reason. The box that arrived wasn't big enough ship back two phones. The valuation of one of the two devices I sold was b.s. - there were no scratches on the device. That's the last time I'm using Gazelle.

Review.Titre: You said my order is on the way but…
Review.Contenu: You said my order is on the way but after more than a week it has not been given to FedEx. Why tell me it is on the way when it isn't. Smells like a scam??

I would have given gazelle a five-star but I am extremely disappointed with the overseas foreign customer service. They are just useless and really cannot give you any personalized service about purchases. The foreign customer service reps we're not able to answer any of my questions. They just kept telling me to go online. This was extremely disappointing

For ordering a device in ‘fair’ condition, it was in much better shape than I anticipated.   This company needs a better exchange process, though - especially if it’s the company’s error. Ordering and setting up the return was easy. However…my experience so far: 2 days to process the order. 4 days to receive it. (Normal so far.) 2 days of troubleshooting, only to find my device was not unlocked as ordered and tied to an obscure MVNO. 4 days to get the phone back to Gazelle, and now it’s currently in its second day of ‘review’. Once this is finalized, then I get a credit within 5 days to start the process all over again, of which I was offered no guarantee this couldn’t happen again nor assurance a comparable device would be available once this whole process is done.  Had things gone right, this could have easily been a 5 star review. Heck, even an immediate exchange/replacement with a provisional credit would have made it 4 stars. I’m just glad I have a backup device in the meantime.

Review.Titre: Good phones but they dont send charging plug.
Review.Contenu: Purchased a phone from them and spent 900 on a phone and all they send is a cable and no charging plug. Another company thats being cheap that sends half a charging system. Going to look elsewhere for phones in the future. How do they expect you to charge the device?

When I first seen the phine it looked to be in perfect condition. After the first day of having it, I noticed the speaker is no good. When you answer calls it's very low. And when you watch videos it is very very low with a echo, needs replaced. So yes I am disappointed.

Review.Titre: Y’all sent me a iPhone that has a…
Review.Contenu: Y’all sent me a iPhone that has a bottom screen lifting and I thought fair condition would be more up kept but this just not cool at all
bought an iphone in 'good' condition that had tons of issues. hasn't happened to me at gazelle before, but such a hassle and bummer

bought a rather expensive, higher end version of the model I picked, site said it was in stock and available;  Nothing on the page stated "will ship when in in stock" or "not available until re-order," or anything like that.  1 week later I get a message saying "your order has been delayed," so I sit tight and be patient; these things happen, and no site/business is perfect.  2 weeks after ordering, I have heard nothing, and my patience had run out, as nothing had arrived yet, and no news or update on what has happened. 3-4 weeks and I'm pissed; I call in, and all they have to tell me is "sorry, it'll be sent out when it is in stock again."  I told them it was supposed to be in stock, and complained I hadn't heard anything about this, or an availability shortage, and he didnt have anything to say about it; not even a discount or rebate, coupon, or ANYTHING to cover the poor shipping experience.  Its 1 and a half months later, and I FINALLY got my device.  whoop-dee-fyukin-doo...

Review.Titre: Phone that I was sold was a blacklisted…
Review.Contenu: Phone that I was sold was a blacklisted phone as it was on a payment plan prior to gazelle getting it and the phone was not paid off. Had to return to gazelle. Once I finally got through to a rep, which took over an hour on hold, I was able to get a return label and rma number. This has soured me on buying used items as no one knew the phone was blacklisted until I connected it to my carrier and then after changing back to my old phone, the carrier blocked my SIM card for daring to touch a blacklisted phone. Had to be on a support call with them using my wife’s phone to get my SIM reinstated. Cost me an entire afternoon of calls to support and gazelle for nothing but a return label. Once the phone is received by gazelle I should have my money refunded.

Review.Titre: Shipping was on time phone was packaged…
Review.Contenu: Shipping was on time phone was packaged great the phone wasn’t in best condition as expected and gazelle offered me 17$ for my great condition iPhone 7. Live and learn.

Review.Titre: Gazelle sent the wrong color phone
Review.Contenu: Gazelle sent the wrong color phone. I ordered green; you sent white.  When I called and waited for 20 minutes, the customer rep, although very nice, was hard to understand. I was quite surprised when she told me Gazelle does not exchange phones.  I wanted to simply exchange the green phone for the white one sent in error. She said I would have to wait to get a return box-5 to 7 days, wait for you to receive it, wait for my refund and then I could purchase another phone.  Pretty disappointed I must say.
I ordered a pixel pro 7 in good condition. When I received the phone it had several small scratches on the screen that weren't too noticeable... but it had one scratches that was very noticeable.

Review.Titre: Gazelle’s phone access is a endless holding pattern.
Review.Contenu: The day after I placed my order I called to withdraw the purchase. I was on hold for three hours. I continued to call over the next two days and still couldn’t get thru. During this time the phone arrived. I went to the website to begin the return-refund process. The return procedure was easy.

Review.Titre: Very slow shipping and not good communication.
Review.Contenu: Took a week for the phone to get shipped out to me and Gazelle didn’t reply to my email when i questioned when the ship date was going to be. Communication is very weak with this company.

When I ordered my phone I was under the impression that it was in stock. I later found out it wasn’t. I wasn’t notified of this for about a week after the purchase. I tried contacting them via email and didn’t receive any reply. So I called them and was on hold for about an hour before I was able to resolve this issue. I have the phone which I’m happy with but the customer service definitely needs improving. I will be very hesitant in buying from Gazelle again.

Review.Titre: Got a phone finally, not exactly what I wanted but fine.
Review.Contenu: I ordered the phone I wanted, went to check on it a few days later - not on its way. I had to call and wait on hold. Turned out they didn't have the phone; had to cancel and get refunded. Talked to person who told me what phones were available. Those didn't appear on website. Ordered another one. After a few days, not on its way. Finally got a person, explained I needed it soon for travel. Two days later, got a message it had been delayed, then minutes later, a message that it was going to ship. Very time-consuming and anxiety provoking. Has company been bought? A long time customer; not my usual experience. Not sure I'll use Gazelel again. I did get my phone though, and all was good, so can't fault that. Not enough employees? Website not updated? Disconcerting.

Review.Titre: Was supposed to be in excellent…
Review.Contenu: Was supposed to be in excellent condition. The phone had sticker marks, scratches and scuffs on the back of it. Not happy I paid for an excellent phone but got a good condition one
Phone freezes.  Battery max capacity is only 82%. Maybe I got a lemon this time.  Been pleased with prior purchases.  Disappointed with this one.

Review.Titre: The phone was locked and to a different carrier
Review.Contenu: The phone was locked and to a different carrier. Very disappointed. This is something you Gazelle should know before sending the phone to a customer. What a waste of my time.
Wrong device sent. Called to complain and find what to do and the employee seemed kind of indifferent. She did give me return instructions.

Review.Titre: Order was accepted though the item was…
Review.Contenu: Order was accepted though the item was out of stock.  Re-ordering added $40 to the cost, and required multiple long waits on hold with customer service phone service.  Disappointing, as I have previously had good experiences with Gazelle.

Review.Titre: I was denied the choice of shipping…
Review.Contenu: I was denied the choice of shipping preference. For security I live & work behind a closed gate, USPS will not keep a gate code available for their postal workers, they call the office (when they feel like it), UPS & FEDEX drivers carry our access codes & have my personal phone number. The phone probably would have been delivered on Saturday, now I sit holding a USELESS “Sorry we missed you, ticket on Monday. Now I can look forward to 4 days of ‘mail’ tag; (more times than I can count, my purchases have been returned undeliverable!! Thank you!!

Disappointing. I ordered an iPhone but shortly after the order was cancelled since (according to the msg I got) it was likely fraudulent. I called to see what was up, was told they didn't have the phone I ordered. Tried again, same result. Soo two problems: bad info on the site, and telling me I was a fraud. Not great.

Gazelle offers good quality items at a variety of price points.  I have had good experiences with them, until I made a mistake: I bought an AT&T network locked iphone.  Apparently, Gazelle does not screen to make sure that network locked phones are eligible for unlock, for example that they are paid off.  In my case, my iPhone worked fine on an AT&T MVNO, but I was not able to activate it on a different network.  AT&T won't unlock the phone because it was not paid off.   Also, AT&T states they will refuse service to a locked phone if it is used by a different account holder from the original.  So in effect, I bought a phone that could be shut down at any time by AT&T, and can't be used on any other network.I think Gazelle should be more transparent about locked phones; they should either screen them and only sell paid off items, or they should warn you that a locked phone could be "blacklisted" by the carrier if it was not paid off.For unlocked phones, and tablets etc., Gazelle is a great way to shop.

Review.Titre: While the phone looks pretty good....
Review.Contenu: While the phone looks pretty good, the battery will only last about 6-8 hours before it dies. Battery life is 90%, but still won't last long. Display is set dim also

They purposely, I think,  come up with an excuse to lower the price offered when your shipment arrives  ... so don't depend on what is said on site or ,even, as in my case, what someone tells you when you call. I got about 35% .
No helpful advice from customer service, just told me to return it. Hold was also long, and person on the phone was very slow to troubleshoot my problem.

Review.Titre: I first bought an iPhone X from gazelle…
Review.Contenu: I first bought an iPhone X from gazelle some years ago and had a great experience. I synced my phone with my computer and took it to the store to activate in place of the old phone, brand new battery, new charger, it worked right away. This time, the phone did not have current software and it alerted me to needing a download for days before I could do anything. Due to some problems with what may have been my home internet, it took days to download and get it installed. I was finally able to sync to my computer yesterday which was nearly two weeks after the arrival of the device. This time, I don’t think the battery has been changed since there is a notice of battery health on the sticker. I’m not sure why they didn’t change the battery since that’s the number one reason a phone would age out of use. This is incredibly annoying since it will have a shorter life than the previous phone I bought. Disappointed. Otherwise the phone appears to be in good repair and I hope it works.

Review.Titre: Repeat gazelle customer not thrilled this time
Review.Contenu: Repeat gazelle customer. Disappointed with this last order, made 11/27, Gazelle charged me for my order and later informed me that my item was out of stock. I would've liked to see them be proactive in supporting me in getting a phone, and not charging me when they did not provide what I paid for. I called customer support and then was guided to an available alternate phone. I had to request and wait on hold for a long time for expedited shipping to be approved. My order is arriving 12/11. Not the greatest experience. Will see what the phone is like. In the past, quality and customer service has been excellent. I'm not sure I would order from Gazelle again based on my most recent experience.

Review.Titre: I have bought from gazelle in the past…
Review.Contenu: I have bought from gazelle in the past and it was rated good . It had a few small scratches hardly visible but this time it had scratch on screen on iPhone 11 that was what I would call fair condition.

In the past I’ve been very satisfied with Gazelle purchases, but this time I’m very disappointed.  Phone had only 80% battery life. I did not expect it to be 100% but thought it would be 85 or over. I’ll think twice about another Gazelle purchase.

Review.Titre: First transaction and not overly impressed.
Review.Contenu: I ordered 3 phones, and all were supposed to be in excellent condition.  One of the phones has a battery life of 85%. I would not have bought the phone had I known this in advance.  I think you should be able to look at battery life prior to purchase.  The phones also took a full week to ship. I find it ironic that I kept receiving emails asking me to review my experience days before receiving my shipment.   The second phone had a 95% battery life, I feel that is more appropriate for an excellent condition phone.  I have not unboxed the third phone yet.

This is the second time I've received an iPhone with a screen issue. This time the bottom ¼ of the screen was non-functional, e.g., I was unable to swipe up to open the phone or tap icons in the dock. Pretty useless.

Review.Titre: It was good but the delivery said on…
Review.Contenu: It was good but the delivery said on the 5th and it’s changed to the next day every day so now it’s the 6th and delivery says the 7th

Review.Titre: The shipping was super quick  but for…
Review.Contenu: The shipping was super quick  but for rating of the phone I purchased that was to have a few scratches the entire phone was scratched up and a huge scratch down the center. It looks like it has been beat to death.

Review.Titre: My order stayed unshipped for a number…
Review.Contenu: My order stayed unshipped for a number of days & I had to call twice. The first person I spoke with told me my order shipped - then I received an email saying my order was delayed & hadn’t shipped. I called again and that person was very helpful & got my order processed quickly.

Review.Titre: Customer service needs to be better
Review.Contenu: My family has been purchasing previously owned iPhones from Gazelle for about 7 years now and it has always been a 5-star experience. Unfortunately, this time was different. In the past, I've spoken with Gazelle's customer service and received professional responses from people who knew how to help me. This time, however, the customer service was AWFUL!! With this most recent purchase, we had a simple issue with a SIM card. We called and spoke with several different representatives (all of whom were in a different country). The only response any of the service reps could give us was to return the phone for a full refund. That was the only solution they could offer. It was like talking to a bot.There was nothing wrong with the phone and we didn't want to repeat the purchase process all over again. The reps said that they could not connect us with a technical dept, a manager or anyone who could troubleshoot our problem.Thankfully, we figured out the solution on our own, but dealing with representatives who all read only one rehearsed sentence from the same script--no matter what the customer needs--was super frustrating. Gazelle needs to replace whatever customer service contractor they're using with reps who can actually offer customer service.

Review.Titre: The phone looks great but there are issues
Review.Contenu: The phone looks great but the loudspeaker doesn't function properly and battery health is 82%.
